DOC.brief_summary: The aim study compare combine ultrasound-guided supraclavicular brachial plexus block distal median , radial , ulnar nerve block , supraclavicular block alone . Sixty two patient undergoing upper extremity surgery randomize supraclavicular ( Group S , n=31 ) supraclavicular + distal ( Group SD , n=31 ) group . Patients group S receive 32 mL lidocaine 1.5 % + epinephrine 5µg/mL group SD receive 20 mL lidocaine 1.5 % + epinephrine 5µg/mL follow distal median , radial , ulnar nerve block use 50:50 mixture lidocaine 2 % + levobupivacaine 0.5 % ( 4 mL/nerve ) . Sensory motor block ulnar , median , radial musculocutaneous nerve assess every 5 minute start 10th minute . The imaging , needle performance time record . Also onset anesthesia relate time , need analgesic first analgesic time note .
DOC.brief_title: The Simultaneous Use Supraclavicular Distal Blocks
DOC.criteria: 18 80 year old patient American Society Anesthesiologists ( ASA ) physical status IIII Scheduled elective hand forearm surgery patient refusal preexist neuropathy coagulopathy allergy agent used pregnancy body mass index > 35 kg/m2 chronic obstructive pulmonary disease infection previous surgery supraclavicular area systemic infection
